H0.text: What are the shape-shifting foxes of the Japanese folklore. Kitsune

H1.text: What are the shape-shifting foxes of the Japanese folklore. Huli Jing

H2.text: What are the shape-shifting foxes of the Japanese folklore. Yokai

H3.text: What are the shape-shifting foxes of the Japanese folklore. Kintsu

A4.text: The kitsune (狐, きつね; IPA: [kʲi̥t͡sɨne̞] ), in popular Japanese folklore, is a fox or fox spirit which possesses the supernatural ability to shapeshift or bewitch other life forms.

A5.text: Folktales from China tell of fox spirits called húli jīng (Chinese: 狐狸精) also known as nine-tailed fox (Chinese: 九尾狐) that may have up to nine tails.
